title: I will be in class 12 in the month of April 2019. Can I take the NDA 1 exam 2019? - Quora

response.answer_text: You can take NDA written exam, but even if you clear it and also clear ssb and also get in the merit list still you cannot join the academy as before joining the academy you would be required to submit 12th class marksheet which you would not be able to produce. If you want to give written for experience then its fine, but ultimately you wont be able to join the academy. Better start preparing from now and give the 2nd NDA of 2019 so that if you clear then you can easily join NDA(which is my dream as well and i am trying to somehow reach to it). All the best for your future, keep the josh high.

Well if your age is within the limits which have been asked by UPSC then you are eligible for the exam.NDA eligibility 2019 - Union Public Service Commission (UPSC) has prescribed the eligibility criteria of NDA (1) 2019 in the notification. The eligibility criteria include nationality, age limit, educational qualification and physical standard. As per NDA eligibility criteria 2019, candidates must be between 16.5 and 19.5 years of age. Candidates having appeared or appearing in class 12 (10+2) examination are eligible to appear for NDA 2019 . Male candidates who are unmarried can apply for the exam . You must ensure that you fulfill all NDA eligibility criteria 2019 before applying for the exam.
